title.narrative: Establishing early intervention services for infants with sensory impairments in Kenya and Uganda (UKAM)

description.narrative: Working with hospitals and primary health centres in poor peri-urban centres of Kenya and Uganda, the first sensory screening programme for children aged 0-3 years will be established. Infants born with complex sensory impairments will have improved developmental outcomes, through accessing a specialist Early Intervention health service. This will contribute to reducing child mortality, developing the case for Governments to roll-out the approach and introduce the rubella vaccination.

activity-date.narrative: A no-cost extension of 3 months has been approved to end of June 2019.
The programme started on 1st April 2016 and has a duration of three years, to 31st March 2019.

mailing-address.narrative: Sense International 101 Pentonville Road, London, N1 9LG, United Kingdom
